Project.Brief history of your project and organi:
Share a brief history of your project and organization
Quantum Finch Research (QFR) is an enterprise R&D organization specializing in advanced laser systems, optical-material diagnostics, and high-precision beam-propagation modeling. Founded in 2019, QFR supports industrial partners in sectors such as:
* manufacturing automation
* precision machining
* semiconductor lithography
* aerospace-grade optical instrumentation
QFR develops proprietary laser calibration models, long-range optical field simulations, and internal performance-tracking datasets for next-generation laser equipment.
As our internal datasets have grown in both size and complexity, we began evaluating decentralized long-term storage solutions. QFR has limited operational knowledge of the Filecoin ecosystem, so part of this application includes seeking:
* assistance with proper data preparation
* guidance on CAR file creation for large scientific datasets
* support from SPs experienced in sealing industrial R&D data
* help identifying stable and reliable Storage Providers
Project.Describe the data being stored onto File:
Describe the data being stored onto Filecoin
The dataset — Laser Systems Optics Research Archive (L-SORA Vault) — contains proprietary internal R&D data used to design, model, calibrate, and validate industrial laser systems.
It includes:
* high-resolution optical simulation outputs
* beamform propagation models
* multi-layer optical coherence measurements
* laser tuning and calibration checkpoints
* thermal drift behavior datasets
* beam-profiling diagnostics captured from experimental hardware
* ML-driven beam-stability predictions
These datasets are critical for:
* iterative development of QFR’s next-generation laser modules
* compliance and traceability in manufacturing environments
* long-term reproducibility of optical experiments
* historical benchmarking and regression testing
This is a closed enterprise dataset, not intended for public access, and stored solely for long-term archiving, auditing, and internal R&D continuity.
Where was the data sourced from?
From QFR’s proprietary optical simulation engines, in-house hardware diagnostics labs, and licensed optical-material datasets under confidentiality agreements.
Project.How do you plan to prepare the dataset: Given our limited experience with the Filecoin ecosystem, and considering that we are not acting as the data preparer, we expect to follow best practices recommended by experienced SPs or by the allocator regarding data preparation and encryption. We will adjust our processes to align with the requirements defined by the Storage Providers or the Filecoin guidelines. We are also actively searching for SPs who can collaborate with us throughout the data storage process.
